bibl.author: Walt Whitman
bibl.title: Walt Whitman to Hannah Whitman Heyde, 1 September 1891
bibl.orgName: The Charles E. Feinberg Collection of the Papers of Walt Whitman, 1839–1919, Library of Congress, Washington, D.C.

body.p: Nothing very new — sun shining today & cool here — have got down stairs every day for the last three after noons wh’ which is quite a feat — sold a big book — rice pudding in old yellow earthen dish (& brotbrought up in same) for my supper — visitors (two little boys to-day dear little fellows) — Am looking for Dr Bucke on his return f'mfrom England — Mrs: O’Connor is here visiting a friend — here yesterday—am half blind & deaf — Love to you & God bless you sister dear $2 enc’denclosed:
